content.description: An engineering student collected data on the maximum height, in feet, and maximum speed, in miles per hour, of thirteen roller coasters. A scatterplot of the data and the least-squares regression line are shown. The maximum heights of five of the roller coasters are <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="105" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>105</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="150" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="200" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="215" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>215</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> feet.
content.question: If the least-squares regression line is used to predict the maximum speed for the five roller coasters, for which maximum height, in feet, would the absolute value of the residual be largest?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
